title: Trump no dijo que dará permisos de trabajo a inmigrantes | Hechos
shortDescription: No encontramos que Donald Trump hubiese anunciado que daría “permiso a inmigrantes trabajadores para estar legal en EEUU”.

title: Planned Nissan layoffs unrelated to Trump tariff plans | Fact check
shortDescription: A company spokesperson said the proposed layoffs have nothing to do with Trump's plan to raise tariffs.

title: Anti-Trump message edited onto Schwarzenegger's T-shirt | Fact check
shortDescription: In the original image Schwarzenegger posted to Instagram in March, the former California governor's black T-shirt is blank.

title: False claim that 425,000 convicts entered US under Biden | Fact check
shortDescription: The ICE data in the posts includes people who have entered the U.S. over the past 40 or more years, not just during the Biden administration.

title: Americans share hopes and fears for second Trump presidency
shortDescription: As President-elect Donald Trump prepares for the White House again, USA TODAY spoke with people across the country to discuss hopes and fears.

title: 'Unemployment never looked so good': Gaetz's wife speaks after withdrawal
shortDescription: Ginger Luckey Gaetz has chimed in publicly after her husband, Matt Gaetz, withdrew his attorney general nomination and announced he won't rejoin Congress.

title: Democrat Bob Casey concedes in PA Senate race
shortDescription: The recount between Sen. Bob Casey and GOP businessman Dave McCormick took weeks, but McCormick kept his lead.

title: No, Newsom didn’t propose keeping state’s income taxes | Fact check
shortDescription: The claim originated with a parody account. A spokesperson for Fox News said the outlet hadn’t reported anything like the claim.

title: Matt Gaetz will not return to Congress next year
shortDescription: President-elect Donald Trump's first pick to serve as the next attorney general won't go back to his seat after dropping out.

title: Senate bill would bar Trump from White House? Not true | Fact check
shortDescription: The Senate has not voted on the bill, which contains civil penalties for noncompliance but would not ban Trump or anyone else from the White House.

title: Trump Nov. 26 sentencing canceled, future of hush money case uncertain
shortDescription: The judge in President-elect Donald Trump's criminal hush money case has indefinitely postponed sentencing, which had been scheduled for Nov. 26.

shortDescription: Donald Trump's energy agenda targets fracking expansion, faster permits and US dominance, sparking debate over economic gains and environmental risks.

shortDescription: Elon Musk is already making his opinions on what is best for the economy known, even if they diverge from Donald Trump's.

title: Potential Trump pardons for Jan. 6 defendants spur hopes, fears
shortDescription: Trump has vowed repeatedly to pardon Jan. 6 defendants, which offers them hope and concerns judges presiding over the sometimes violent cases.

title: Trump nominated RFK Jr. to lead health agencies. What this could mean for the nation.
shortDescription: If RFK Jr.'s nomination is approved, he would be in charge of agencies tasked with things from medical research to public health.

title: House passes bill that expands federal power to target nonprofits
shortDescription: H.R. 9495 would authorize the treasury secretary to designate nonprofits as supporters of terrorism and strip them of their tax-exempt status.

title: Post falsely claims Trump left Mar-a-Lago in an ambulance | Fact check
shortDescription: A Secret Service spokesperson said no one protected by his agency was taken from the property for medical reasons or had any issues or concerns.

title: Trump hasn't signed transition of power agreements, White House says
shortDescription: Two weeks after his election victory, Donald Trump still has not signed documents needed to formally begin the transfer of power from Biden.
